text: Write down the name of A, B, C and D in the given figure. A-Anther, B-Filament, C-Pollen grains, D-Pollen sac A–Filament; B–Anther; C–Tapetum; D–Connective A–Anther; B–Pedicel; C–Ovules; D–Locule of ovary A–Anther lobe; B–Style; C–Microspore mother cells;D–Endothecium
hint: A is the anther (terminal, bilobed); B the filament (stalk). The anther is tetrasporangiate—each lobe bears two pollen sacs (microsporangia) (D) that contain pollen grains/microspores (C) at maturity.
